column1: text

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r2q1rk1/pbp2p2/1p4p1/3p2N1/2P3nQ/3B4/PP3PPP/R3R1K1 b - - 0 17 ### Next Move: 17 …Nf6 ### Explanation: [/INST] And Black must dance to the tune, by bringing the knight back to f6.
Here too Black posts the knight on a good square, but not of his own free will. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: 8/1p3ppp/4p3/1k6/3PpP2/4P2P/1bK3P1/8 w - - 0 35 ### Next Move: 35 Kxb2 ### Explanation: [/INST] The only move. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1bq1rk1/p1p1bppp/1p2pn2/6B1/3P3Q/3B1N2/PPP2PPP/R4RK1 b - - 1 11 ### Next Move: 11 ...g6 ### Explanation: [/INST] On the alternative 11 ...h6 White wins by 12 Bxf6 Bxf6 13 Qe4, when the threat of mate wins the rook on a8, an innocent bystander. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: rq1k1r2/pppbbB1p/4QN2/4n3/5N2/5P2/PP4PP/2KR3R b - - 0 20 ### Next Move: 20 …Bd6 ### Explanation: [/INST] Interfering with the rook’s action on the open file and thereby threatening to take the queen.
Other defences promise no favourable results:
1)20 ...Rxf7 21 Rxd7+ and mate in two.
2)20 ...Bxf6 21 Qxf6+ Kc8 22 Qxe5 Rxf7 23 Qh8+.
3)20 ...Qc8 21 Qxe5 Rxf7 22 Ne6#.
With the text, Black unpins his d7-bishop, guards the e5-knight, attacks the queen and threatens the f7-bishop. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1bqk2r/pp3ppp/2n1pn2/2bp4/2P2B2/2N2N2/PPQ1PPPP/R3KB1R w KQkq - 0 8 ### Next Move: 8 e3 ### Explanation: [/INST] Another quiet move which liberates one bishop and strengthens the position of the other. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1b2rk1/p5pp/npn5/2q1ppN1/2P2B2/PQ2PB2/5PPP/1R1R2K1 w - - 1 20 ### Next Move: 20 Bxc6 ### Explanation: [/INST] After the recapture 20 ...Qxc6, there comes 21 c5+ Kh8 22 Nf7+ Kg8 (or 22 ...Rxf7 23 Rd8+ and White forces mate) 23 Nh6++ Kh8 24 Qg8+!  Rxg8 25 Nf7#!
Black did not wait to be convinced by a demonstration over the board but turned down his king in surrender. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r3r1k1/pp3pb1/q1n1b1p1/2N1p1N1/7Q/2P1B3/PP3PPP/R4RK1 b - - 5 20 ### Next Move: 20 …Qc4 ### Explanation: [/INST] Hoping to get some peace by effecting an exchange of queens. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: rn1q1rk1/pbp1bppp/1p2pn2/3P2B1/3P4/2NBPN2/PP3PPP/R2QK2R b KQ - 0 8 ### Next Move: 8 ...exd5 ### Explanation: [/INST] Black wants to maintain a pawn in the centre, but this pawn blocks the path of his b7-bishop and prevents it from accomplishing anything useful on the diagonal.
Black could have captured with a piece instead, but that amounts to an eventual surrender of the centre. White would evict the piece by e4 and remain in control of all the strategically important central squares. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r2r2k1/pb2bppp/1p2pn2/3q4/3n4/PP1B4/3N1PPP/RQB1NRK1 b - - 3 14 ### Next Move: 14 …Qh5 ### Explanation: [/INST] There is no direct threat in this queen move, but Black threatens to threaten! He intends to storm White’s citadel of pawns with his queen supported by a minor piece, for instance by 15 ...Bd6 or 15 ...Ng4. This would compel one of the pawns to leave its base and create weaknesses that Black could exploit. The advanced pawn itself might be susceptible to attack, or avenues might be opened leading to the king.
This chipping away at the foundation is an interesting process for rendering an apparently strongly fortified position vulnerable to assault. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: rnbqkbnr/pp3ppp/2p1p3/3p4/2PP4/4PN2/PP3PPP/RNBQKB1R b KQkq - 0 4 ### Next Move: 4 …Nf6 ### Explanation: [/INST] The knight takes up a good post, extending powerful influence on d5 and e4, two of the four strategically important squares in the centre. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r4rk1/pb2bppp/1pn1pn2/3q4/3p4/PP1BPN2/2QN1PPP/R1B2RK1 w - - 0 12 ### Next Move: 12 exd4 ### Explanation: [/INST] White opens the position to get some counterplay; he hopes to utilize the e- file for his rook and the e4-square as a pivot for his pieces.
Instead the superficially attractive 12 e4 does not accomplish much, as after 12 ...Qh5 the vital e4-square is occupied by a pawn, making it unavailable for the manoeuvring of pieces, while Black benefits in having an extra passed pawn on the d-file. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: 2r1kb1r/pp3ppp/4pn2/1b1p4/3P1P2/P3PN2/1PqN2PP/R1BQR1K1 w k - 0 14 ### Next Move: 14 Qxc2 ### Explanation: [/INST] So he exchanges his helpless queen for Black’s active one. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: 8/4kp2/5p2/2r4p/2B5/4KPP1/8/8 w - - 8 50 ### Next Move: 50 a6 ### Explanation: [/INST] 50 Kd4 Rg5 wins a pawn at once, while 50 Ba2 is refuted by 50...f5, clearing f6 for Black’s king. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: rnbqkbnr/pppp1ppp/8/4p3/2P5/8/PP1PPPPP/RNBQKBNR w KQkq - 0 2 ### Next Move: 2 Nc3 ### Explanation: [/INST] White brings a piece out in preference to advancing a centre pawn.
In fact, on 2 d4 exd4 3 Qxd4 Nc6 the queen must retreat and lose a move. Or if 2 e4, White remains with a backward d-pawn, while the f1-bishop cannot get to c4. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r2qr1k1/1b2b1p1/p1p1p2p/1p3p2/3PB3/P3PN2/1PQ2PPP/3R1RK1 w - - 0 17 ### Next Move: 17 Bd3 ### Explanation: [/INST] The third visit of the bishop to this square. White must not be hasty and play 17 Bxc6 as the reply 17...Rc8 pins the bishop. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1bqk2r/ppp1bppp/1nn5/4p3/8/2N2NP1/PP1PPPBP/R1BQ1RK1 w kq - 6 8 ### Next Move: 8 d3 ### Explanation: [/INST] White makes room for the c1-bishop to take a hand in the game. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: rnb1k1nr/ppp2ppp/8/q3p3/1b1P4/2N2N2/PPP2PPP/R1BQKB1R w KQkq - 2 6 ### Next Move: 6 Bd2 ### Explanation: [/INST] Chess can be so simple! White brings a third piece into play and at the same time eases the strain on his knight.
Meanwhile he threatens 7 Nxe5, against which Black has no defence in 6...Nc6 as 7 a3 Bxc3 8 Bxc3 attacks the queen and wins the enemy pawn on e5.  </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1bq1rk1/pp1nbppp/2p1pn2/3p2B1/2PP4/P1N1PN2/1PQ2PPP/R3KB1R b KQ - 4 8 ### Next Move: 8 ...a6 ### Explanation: [/INST] Preparation for the manoeuvre 9...dxc4 10 Bxc4 b5 11 Bd3 Bb7, followed by an eventual ...c5. This would serve to develop the c8-bishop, free his queenside and start action against White’s pawn-centre. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r2q1rk1/pb2bppp/1pn1pn2/3P4/3p4/PP1BPN2/2QN1PPP/R1B2RK1 b - - 0 11 ### Next Move: 11 …Qxd5 ### Explanation: [/INST] Black nets a pawn with this and (as if it were not enough) takes over the attack.
The queen is in no danger, as White’s pieces are not sufficiently well developed to cause her any inconvenience. </s>

<s>[INST] You are given notations of chess board positions and the next chess move. Explain why it is the best move.     ### Chess board positions: r1b1r1k1/qp2bppp/p4nn1/4p3/8/1NN1PBB1/PP3PPP/1QRR2K1 w - - 6 19 ### Next Move: 19 Na5 ### Explanation: [/INST] A fine preventive move! It stops 19 ...Rb8 followed by 20 ...b5 as then 21 Nc6 wins the exchange, while the direct 19 ...Bd7 or 19 ...Be6 costs Black his b-pawn.
Notice how White not only sees to the development of his own pieces but hinders that of his opponent. </s>
